title: Drawing, 1938-88-1978
medium: Pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, graphite
markings:
Verso: Cooper Union Museum for the Arts of Decoration (Lugt#457d)
Watermark: bird above triple mount with "C N" beside, in circle; above "F" (RB'45)
inscribed: Inscription at right: capo foco da farsi in/ metallo per L'Esma/ Duchessa Grilla, scarta/ to per la spesa; questo/ figura li tre Elementi/ che sostegano il quarto/ non potendo star uno/ senza l'altro. A 1775. (RB'45)
provenance: Ex collection: Piancastelli and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Vertical rectangle. The supports consist of two crossing dolphins, with upright tails. They are connected by  a festoon. Around the two inside tails are spiraals which support the half-figure of a child, carrying a cornucopia, the contents of which is crowned with the sixteen-pointed star. Usual background.
